titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lucinda Franks Papers, approximately 1999-2013

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Mark Seidl April 2020

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Correspondence, manuscrips and typescripts of Lucinda Franks's book, Timeless.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Lucinda Franks was born in 1946 and graduated from Vassar College in 1968. She has worked as a journalist, reporting for the United Press International, The New York Times, The Atlanic, and other publications. Franks's reporting on the life and death of Diana Oughton, a member of the anti-war terrorist organization, The Weathermen, earned her a Pulizer Prize for National Reporting in 1971. She is also author of two acclaimed memoirs, My Father's Secret War(2007), about her father's service as a secret agent during World War II, and Timeless: Love, Morgenthau, and Me (2014).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of correspondence, as well as manuscrips and typescripts of Lucinda Franks's book, Timeless.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Lucinda Franks via Lila Meade (M2016-015).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Lucinda Franks Papers, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

dsc.head: Container List
dsc.p: There is no container list currently available for this collection.
